result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee Donald Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Submit a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Pay all costs and surcharges by 12/1/2015.  Penalty if not paid, convert to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with case 15CM002772 and to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lee Donald Lee

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lee Donald Lee in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Lee Donald Lee in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to case 15CM002772 and to any other sentence with credit for 57 days served.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 12-01-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
from JusticePoint advising that the defendant is in custody on another matter and has missed a scheduled office contact and drug/breathalyzer test.

Defendant Lee Donald Lee in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Lee Donald Lee in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense moves to withdraw at the request of the defendant.  Court grants defense motion to withdraw as counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Pick N Save, 6950 West State Street
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lee Donald Lee in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Lee Donald Lee in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
